'''Orontor''' was a [[Númenóreans|Númenórean]] [[Men|man]] who was the father of [[Fíriel (The Lost Road)|Fíriel]] according to the early version of the [[legendarium]] in ''[[The Lost Road]]''.

== History ==
Orontor was a good friend of [[Elendil]], but at some point in time, he had departed [[Númenor]]. Men speculated that he had gained the displeasure of the king and had fled on a long voyage. However, the truth was that he was on a mysterious mission and would likely never be seen again or be seen again too late.<ref>{{LR|P1III2}}, p. 62</ref> He left behind his daughter, Fíriel, in Elendil's house where she sang a [[Fíriel's song|sad song]] from a high window.

== Etymology ==
The meaning of ''Oronto'' is never given, but it could include the [[Quenya]] element ''[[oron]]'' ("mountain"). The name was created in an early step of Quenya development, but it was later used as an example of ''anessi'' ("given name").<ref>{{PE|21}}, p. 86</ref>

== Other versions of the legendarium ==
[[Christopher Tolkien]] points out that Orontor's mission, "from which he might never return", could be a precedent of the voyage of [[Amandil]] to the West in the final version of ''[[Akallabêth]]''.<ref>{{LR|P1III2}}, ''Note on the Númenórean chapters'', p. 71</ref>
